name: arrayEvery
syntax: arrayEvery(array array, function(item, [index, [array]]) closure, [boolean parallel], [number maxThreads])
description: returns true if every closure returns true, otherwise false

params.name: closure
params.description: A function / closure with the signature: `boolean function (any item, [numeric index], [array array])`

params.name: parallel
params.description: Lucee4.5+ When `true` the items can be executed in parallel

params.name: maxThreads
params.description: Lucee4.5+ The number of threads to use when `parallel=true`

links.title: Map, Reduce and other Higher Order Functions
links.description: A Primer for map, reduce, filter, and Higher Order Functions in general.

examples.title: Example for positive result
examples.description: Checks whether all items in an array are greater than 2 and outputs true because all of them fulfill the requirement.
examples.code:
array = [4, 5, 6, 7];
writeOutput(arrayEvery(array, function(value) { return value gt 2; }));

examples.title: Example for negative result
examples.description: Checks whether all items in an array are greater than 2 and outputs false because some of them do not fulfill the requirement.
examples.code:
array = [1, 2, 3, 4];
writeOutput(arrayEvery(array, function(value) { return value gt 2; }));
